intro: Tithymalus trapezoidalis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
